attributes.action: help all low paid who are still worse off even after the new starting rate of income tax introduced 13th May 2008
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
After the removal of the 10p tax rate and the subsequent introduction of a new higher starting rate for income tax, there are, according to statistics, 1.1 million tax payers still worse off.
These are low earners with incomes between £6,000- £13,000 not in receipt of benefits who still lose out by paying more tax, when the remaining population all gain. How can this be fair?
